snippet: A report prepared in late March by an outside management consultant said a “lack of transparency and alignment on critical issues” was threatening progress.
abstract: House investigators release documents showing that Senior Obama administration officials were warned by outside management consultant early in 2013 that effort to build the HealthCare.gov site was falling behind and at risk of failure.

byline.original: By SHARON LaFRANIERE and ERIC LIPTON
byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A report prepared in late March by an outside management consultant said a “lack of transparency and alignment on critical issues” was threatening progress.

headline.main: Officials Were Warned About Health Site Woes
headline.print_headline: Officials Were Warned About Health Site Woes

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
